title: introduction
text: senimuse package provides straightforward tools access search museum collection data via public APIs. currently supports Art Institute Chicago (ARTIC) Metropolitan Museum Art (MET), allowing R users incorporate cultural datasets research, education, data visualization projects.

title: introduction
text: package offers two main functions: get_artworks() - Retrieve specific artwork(s) using object IDs search_artworks() - Search museum collections keyword Let’s explore use functions examples:

title: introduction
text: know ID artwork want access, use get_artworks():
code: library(senimuse)  # Get data for a single artwork from Art Institute of Chicago (default museum) artic_artwork <- get_artworks(4) print(artic_artwork) #>   id          title date_display                                 artist_display #> 1  4 Priest and Boy         n.d. Lawrence Carmichael Earle\nAmerican, 1845-1921 #>                             dimensions #> 1 47.2 × 34.5 cm (18 5/8 × 13 5/8 in.) #>                                 medium_display #> 1 Watercolor over graphite on cream wove paper  # Get a specific artwork from the Metropolitan Museum of Art met_artwork <- get_artworks(436535, museum = "met") print(met_artwork) #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   id     title             artist_display date_display medium_display dimensions #>   <chr>  <chr>             <chr>          <chr>        <chr>          <chr>      #> 1 436535 Wheat Field with… Vincent van G… 1889         Oil on canvas  28 7/8 × …

title: introduction
text: discover artworks based keywords, use search_artworks():
code:
# Search for artworks related to "sunflowers" in ARTIC sunflower_artworks <- search_artworks("sunflowers") #> [1] "sunflowers" print(sunflower_artworks) #>        id                                   title    date_display #> 1  197508                               Sunflower            1981 #> 2   20029    Sunflowers, Marché St Germain, Paris         1888/93 #> 3   35720                              Sunflowers August 20, 1895 #> 4   39129                       Border (Fragment)       1750/1800 #> 5   97390                              Sunflowers         c. 1940 #> 6  112885 Decorative Study: Woman with Sunflowers         1892/98 #> 7  151513          Young Woman Seated in a Garden         c. 1896 #> 8  150852           Sunflower (Furnishing Fabric)            1962 #> 9  186048                                  Clytie            1868 #> 10  18421           State Birds and Flowers Quilt         c. 1950 #>                                                                                       artist_display #> 1                                                                 Katsuda Yukio
Japanese, born 1941 #> 2                                                        James McNeill Whistler
American, 1834-1903 #> 3                                                                 Georges Lemmen
Belgian, 1865-1916 #> 4                                                                Belgium, Flanders, probably Antwerp #> 5                                              Edward Steichen
American, born Luxembourg, 1879–1973 #> 6                                         Attributed to Aubrey Vincent Beardsley
English, 1872-1898 #> 7                                                         Pierre-Georges Jeanniot
French, 1848-1934 #> 8  Designed by Howard Carter (English, active c. 1962)
Produced by Heal's Fabrics 
England, London #> 9                                                        George Frederick Watts (English, 1817–1904) #> 10                Jeannette Dean Throckmorton (American, 1883–1963)
United States, Iowa, Des Moines #>                                                                                                                dimensions #> 1                                                                                                                    <NA> #> 2              Image, trimmed within platemark: 22 × 27.8 cm (8 11/16 × 11 in.); Sheet: 22.3 × 27.8 cm (8 13/16 × 11 in.) #> 3                                                                                     61.5 × 47 cm (24 1/4 × 18 9/16 in.) #> 4  11.6 × 35.8 cm (4 5/8 × 14 1/8 in.); Repeat Upper border: W.: 8.6 cm (3 3/8 in.); Main border: H.: 14.7 cm (5 3/4 in.) #> 5                                                                                   38.5 × 40.8 cm (15 3/16 × 16 1/8 in.) #> 6                                                                                      12.8 × 8.5 cm (5 1/16 × 3 3/8 in.) #> 7                                                                                   43.8 × 26.4 cm (17 1/4 × 10 7/16 in.) #> 8                                          251.1 × 120.6 cm (98 7/8 × 47 1/2 in.); Warp repeat: H.: 126.1 cm (49 5/8 in.) #> 9                                                                                                      H.: 89 cm (35 in.) #> 10                                                                                     224.6 × 172.7 cm (88 3/8 × 68 in.) #>                                                                                                                              medium_display #> 1                                                                                                                     Color woodblock print #> 2                                                                             Etching with foul biting in black ink on ivory Japanese paper #> 3                                                                                                    Watercolor, with pen and ink, on paper #> 4                                                   Cotton, bobbin straight lace of a type known as "Mechlin" with a kat stitch mesh ground #> 5                                                                                                                      Dye imbibition print #> 6                                                Pen and black ink, with brush and black wash, over traces of graphite, on ivory wove paper #> 7                                                                                            Woodcut in black and brown on white wove paper #> 8                                                                                                       Cotton, plain weave; screen printed #> 9                                                                                                                                   Plaster #> 10 Appliquéd and embroidered quilt; dyed and undyed cotton plain weave fabrics; cotton embroidery threads; graphite pencil pattern outlines  # Search for works by Monet in the Met collection monet_artworks <- search_artworks("monet", museum = "met") #> [1] "monet" print(monet_artworks) #> # A tibble: 10 × 6 #>    id     title            artist_display date_display medium_display dimensions #>    <chr>  <chr>            <chr>          <chr>        <chr>          <chr>      #>  1 438003 Camille Monet (… Claude Monet   1873         Oil on canvas  23 7/8 x … #>  2 437133 Garden at Saint… Claude Monet   1867         Oil on canvas  38 5/8 x … #>  3 437127 Bridge over a P… Claude Monet   1899         Oil on canvas  36 1/2 x … #>  4 437125 Morning on the … Claude Monet   1897         Oil on canvas  32 1/8 x … #>  5 459107 Houses on the A… Claude Monet   1871         Oil on canvas  17 3/8 × … #>  6 437124 Rouen Cathedral… Claude Monet   1894         Oil on canvas  39 1/4 x … #>  7 437106 Spring (Fruit T… Claude Monet   1873         Oil on canvas  24 1/2 x … #>  8 437122 Haystacks (Effe… Claude Monet   1891         Oil on canvas  25 3/4 x … #>  9 437121 The Four Trees   Claude Monet   1891         Oil on canvas  32 1/4 x … #> 10 438823 The Manneporte … Claude Monet   1883         Oil on canvas  25 3/4 x …

title: introduction
text: functions allow specify fields return:
code: # Get specific fields for multiple artworks selected_fields <- get_artworks(   c(27992, 28560),    museum = "artic",   fields = c("title", "artist_display", "date_display") ) print(selected_fields) #>                                title                  date_display #> 1 A Sunday on La Grande Jatte — 1884 1884–86, border added 1888–89 #> 2                        The Bedroom                          1889 #>                        artist_display #> 1  Georges Seurat (French, 1859–1891) #> 2 Vincent van Gogh (Dutch, 1853–1890)  # Increase the number of search results landscape_artworks <- search_artworks(   "landscape",    museum = "met",    size = 25 ) #> [1] "landscape"

title: introduction
text: functions return data tibble (data frame) format, integrates smoothly tidyverse operations:
code: library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  # Filter for artworks from a specific period impressionist_works <- search_artworks("impressionism", museum = "met") %>%   filter(grepl("19th century", date_display)) #> [1] "impressionism"  # Count artworks by artist artist_counts <- search_artworks("portrait", size = 30) %>%   group_by(artist_display) %>%   summarize(count = n()) %>%   arrange(desc(count)) #> [1] "portrait"

title: introduction
text: Currently, senimuse supports: * Art Institute Chicago (“artic”) * Metropolitan Museum Art (“met”) package standardizes column names across museum APIs easier comparison analysis.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Farhan Reynaldo Hutabarat. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Reynaldo Hutabarat F (2025). senimuse: R API wrapper museum collections. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/farhanreynaldo/senimuse.
code: @Manual{,   title = {senimuse: R API wrapper for museum collections},   author = {Farhan {Reynaldo Hutabarat}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/farhanreynaldo/senimuse}, }

what: R API wrapper for museum collections
title: R API wrapper for museum collections
text: goal senimuse provide R interface museum API, allowing users easily access analyze artwork data collection. package simplifies process retrieving information artworks, artists, exhibitions museum resources data analysis, visualization, research purposes.

title: R API wrapper for museum collections
text: can install development version senimuse GitHub :

title: R API wrapper for museum collections
text: simple example use senimuse package search artworks Monet Art Institute Chicago museum. search_artworks() function allows search artworks based various criteria, artist name, title, museum. can also specify fields want retrieve API. example, want get artwork ID, title, artist display name, can use fields argument: know artwork ID, can use get_artwork() function retrieve detailed information specific artwork. example, get information artwork ID 28067 Metropolitan Museum Art, can use following code:
code: library(senimuse)  search_artworks("Monet", museum = "artic", size = 5) #> [1] "Monet" #>       id                                            title date_display #> 1  14624             Stacks of Wheat (End of Day, Autumn)      1890–91 #> 2  16568                                     Water Lilies         1906 #> 3  64818                  Stacks of Wheat (End of Summer)      1890–91 #> 4  14620                          Cliff Walk at Pourville         1882 #> 5  14598                      The Beach at Sainte-Adresse         1867 #> 6  16571 Arrival of the Normandy Train, Gare Saint-Lazare         1877 #> 7  16564          Branch of the Seine near Giverny (Mist)         1897 #> 8  81539             On the Bank of the Seine, Bennecourt         1868 #> 9  81537                                       Bordighera         1884 #> 10 87088                                  Water Lily Pond         1900 #>                      artist_display #> 1  Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #> 2  Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #> 3  Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #> 4  Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #> 5  Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #> 6  Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #> 7  Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #> 8  Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #> 9  Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #> 10 Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #>                                                                                             dimensions #> 1  65.8 × 101 cm (27 7/8 × 39 3/4 in.); Framed: 90.9 × 125.5 × 123.2 cm (35 3/4 × 49 3/8 × 48 1/2 in.) #> 2    89.9 × 94.1 cm (35 3/8 × 37 1/16 in.); Framed: 103.2 × 107 × 5.8 cm (40 5/8 × 42 1/8 × 2 1/4 in.) #> 3    60 × 100.5 cm (23 5/8 × 39 9/16 in.); Framed: 75.6 × 116.6 × 7.4 cm (29 3/4 × 45 7/8 × 2 7/8 in.) #> 4      66.5 × 82.3 cm (26 1/8 × 32 7/16 in.); Framed: 88.9 × 104.8 × 10.8 cm (35 × 41 1/4 × 4 1/4 in.) #> 5  75.8 × 102.5 cm (29 13/16 × 40 5/16 in.); Framed: 104.1 × 130.2 × 11.4 cm (41 × 51 1/2 × 4 1/2 in.) #> 6       60.3 × 80.2 cm (23 3/4 × 31 1/2 in.); Framed: 80.7 × 100.4 × 10.2 cm (31 3/4 × 39 1/2 × 4 in.) #> 7  89.9 × 92.7 cm (35 3/8 × 36 1/2 in.); Framed: 112.4 × 115.6 × 11.5 cm (44 1/4 × 45 1/2 × 4 1/2 in.) #> 8    81.5 × 100.7 cm (32 1/16 × 39 5/8 in.); Framed: 98.5 × 117.8 × 8 cm (38 3/4 × 46 3/8 × 3 1/8 in.) #> 9         65 × 80.8 cm (25 5/8 × 31 13/16 in.); Framed: 80.4 × 96.6 × 8.3 cm (31 5/8 × 38 × 3 1/4 in.) #> 10      89.8 × 101 cm (35 3/8 × 39 3/4 in.); Framed: 112.4 × 122.6 × 10.2 cm (44 1/4 × 48 1/4 × 4 in.) #>    medium_display #> 1   Oil on canvas #> 2   Oil on canvas #> 3   Oil on canvas #> 4   Oil on canvas #> 5   Oil on canvas #> 6   Oil on canvas #> 7   Oil on canvas #> 8   Oil on canvas #> 9   Oil on canvas #> 10  Oil on canvas search_artworks("Monet", museum = "artic", fields = c("id", "title", "artist_display")) #> [1] "Monet" #>       id                                            title #> 1  14624             Stacks of Wheat (End of Day, Autumn) #> 2  16568                                     Water Lilies #> 3  64818                  Stacks of Wheat (End of Summer) #> 4  14620                          Cliff Walk at Pourville #> 5  14598                      The Beach at Sainte-Adresse #> 6  16571 Arrival of the Normandy Train, Gare Saint-Lazare #> 7  16564          Branch of the Seine near Giverny (Mist) #> 8  81539             On the Bank of the Seine, Bennecourt #> 9  81537                                       Bordighera #> 10 87088                                  Water Lily Pond #>                      artist_display #> 1  Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #> 2  Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #> 3  Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #> 4  Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #> 5  Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #> 6  Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #> 7  Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #> 8  Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #> 9  Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) #> 10 Claude Monet (French, 1840–1926) artwork_id <- 437984 get_artworks(artwork_id, museum = "met") #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   id     title             artist_display date_display medium_display dimensions #>   <chr>  <chr>             <chr>          <chr>        <chr>          <chr>      #> 1 437984 La Berceuse (Wom… Vincent van G… 1889         Oil on canvas  36 1/2 × …

what: Retrieve Gallery Information from the Art Institute of Chicago API — galleries
title: Retrieve Gallery Information from the Art Institute of Chicago API — galleries
text: Fetches complete list galleries Art Institute Chicago's public API, automatically handling pagination return available records. function implements rate limiting comply API best practices.

title: Retrieve Gallery Information from the Art Institute of Chicago API — galleries
Retrieve Gallery Information from the Art Institute of Chicago API — galleries
text: tibble (data frame) row represents one gallery, containing   available fields provided API.

title: Retrieve Gallery Information from the Art Institute of Chicago API — galleries
text: Art Institute Chicago API documentation: https://api.artic.edu/docs

title: Retrieve Gallery Information from the Art Institute of Chicago API — galleries
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get all galleries gallery_data <- galleries() } # }

what: Retrieve Artwork Data from Museum APIs — get_artworks
title: Retrieve Artwork Data from Museum APIs — get_artworks
text: Fetches artwork information various museum public APIs using object IDs optionally specifies fields return.

title: Retrieve Artwork Data from Museum APIs — get_artworks
Retrieve Artwork Data from Museum APIs — get_artworks
text: object_ids vector artwork object IDs (numeric character). identifiers correspond unique IDs used museum's collection. NULL. museum character string indicating museum query. Currently supports: "artic" - Art Institute Chicago "met" - Metropolitan Museum Art fields optional vector field names (character) return artwork. NULL (default), returns available fields.

title: Retrieve Artwork Data from Museum APIs — get_artworks
text: tibble (data frame) row represents one artwork columns   contain requested fields. structure varies depending requested fields   museum API.

title: Retrieve Artwork Data from Museum APIs — get_artworks
text: Art Institute Chicago API: https://api.artic.edu/docs/ Metropolitan Museum Art API: https://metmuseum.github.io/

title: Retrieve Artwork Data from Museum APIs — get_artworks
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get artwork from Art Institute of Chicago get_artworks(4, museum = "artic")  # Get artwork from Metropolitan Museum of Art get_artworks(436535, museum = "met")  # Get multiple artworks with specific fields get_artworks(c(27992, 28560), museum = "artic",              fields = c("title", "artist_display", "date_display")) } # }

what: Search for Artworks from Museum APIs — search_artworks
title: Search for Artworks from Museum APIs — search_artworks
text: Searches artworks museum collections based query string returns artwork data matching items.

title: Search for Artworks from Museum APIs — search_artworks
Search for Artworks from Museum APIs — search_artworks
text: query character string containing search query. NULL. Spaces automatically converted hyphens. museum character string indicating museum query. Currently supports: "artic" - Art Institute Chicago "met" - Metropolitan Museum Art fields optional vector field names (character) return artwork. NULL (default), returns available fields. size maximum number results return. Defaults 10.

title: Search for Artworks from Museum APIs — search_artworks
text: tibble (data frame) row represents one artwork matching search   criteria columns contain requested fields.

title: Search for Artworks from Museum APIs — search_artworks
text: Art Institute Chicago API: https://api.artic.edu/docs/ Metropolitan Museum Art API: https://metmuseum.github.io/

title: Search for Artworks from Museum APIs — search_artworks
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Search for artworks related to "sunflowers" in Art Institute of Chicago search_artworks("sunflowers", museum = "artic")  # Search Met Museum with specific fields to return search_artworks("monet", museum = "met", fields = c("title", "artistDisplayName", "objectDate"))  # Search with a larger result set search_artworks("landscape", museum = "artic", size = 25) } # }
